titleStmt.title: Milton Hamilton to James R. Page
CWG6200

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Burlington 11 March 1865
James R. Page Esq Assistant
Secretary of State
Dear Sir
Yours of the 8th. Inst. is received and I herewith enclose to you $2 for which be kind enough to send Receipt.
It appears that my friend Robert Richardson Esq. has misinformed you in regard to names
The case originally stood thus Comlth vs Ealine slave Wickliffe Grubbs and William Grubbs entered into a recognizance in penalty of $100 for her appearance in Boone circuit court.

The summons now is against cathraine Grubbs adminisratrix of Wickliffe Grubbs deceased & William Grubbs to shew why comlth. shall not have judgment for $100 on forfeited recognizance, and we ask that Govenor remit all but costs
How is my old friend Thos. S. Page Esq present him my kindest regards, I trust you will attend to matters above speedily
